00014 namespace BulletHell.System
00015 {
00016     #region Class Vs. Struct
00017     /*
00018      * Here are just some of the differences between a struct and a class:
00019     *     Classes are reference types and structs are value types. Since classes are reference type, 
00020     *         a class variable can be assigned null, but we cannot assign null to a struct variable, since structs are value type.
00021     *     You will always be dealing with reference to an object ( instance ) of a class. 
00022      *         But you will not be dealing with references to an instance of a struct, you will be dealing directly with struct
00023     *     Classes must be instantiated using the new operator, but structs can be instantiated without using the new operator.
00024     *     Classes support inheritance.But there is no inheritance for structs, (structs don't support inheritance polymorphism )
00025     *     It is not mandatory to initialize all Fields inside the constructor of a class. But all the Fields of a struct must be 
00026      *         fully initialized inside the constructor.
00027     *     Structs object is allocated in the stack, and the class object is allocated in the heap.
00028      */
00029     #endregion
00030 
00031     public class MenuNode
00032     {
00033         public string Title { get; private set; }
00034         public GameState GameState { get; set; }
00035         public bool Active { get; set; }
00036 
00037         public MenuNode(string title, bool active){
00038             Title = title;
00039             Active = active; // if inactive, the title will not be selectable and is drawn with gray color.
00040         }
00041     }
00042 }
